Sentencas: Power generation using gas turbine (GT) power plants operating on the Brayton cycle suffers from low efficiencies, resulting in poor fuel to power conversion.
Titulo: Thermo-economic optimization of an indirectly coupled solid oxide fuel cell/gas turbine hybrid power plant

Sentencas: A solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is proposed for integration into a 10-MW GT power plant, operating at 30% efficiency, in order to improve system efficiencies and economics.
Titulo: Thermo-economic optimization of an indirectly coupled solid oxide fuel cell/gas turbine hybrid power plant

Sentencas: The SOFC system is indirectly coupled to the GT, in order to minimize the disruption to the GT operation.
Titulo: Thermo-economic optimization of an indirectly coupled solid oxide fuel cell/gas turbine hybrid power plant

Sentencas: A thermo-economic model is developed to simulate the hybrid power plant and to optimize its performance using the method of Lagrange Multipliers.
Titulo: Thermo-economic optimization of an indirectly coupled solid oxide fuel cell/gas turbine hybrid power plant

Sentencas: It predicts an optimized power output of 18.9 MW at 48.5% efficiency, and a breakeven per-unit energy cost of USD 4.54 phi kW h(-1) for the hybrid system based on futuristic mass generation SOFC costs.
Titulo: Thermo-economic optimization of an indirectly coupled solid oxide fuel cell/gas turbine hybrid power plant
